intro: Callitriche heterophylla subsp. bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander’s water starwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are often divided into narrow segments. The plant produces tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and lakes. Its morphology varies depending on water conditions, making it an adaptable aquatic species.
